allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 1: Wide in mercy for His creation, believers and disbelievers alike
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 2: The giver of reward manifold for good deeds
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 3: The sovereign who does whatever He wills with His dominion
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 4: Transcendent beyond any description that human senses or imagination can perceive
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 5: Free from any imperfection, flaw, or deficiency, and His peace encompasses His creation
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 6: The verifier of Himself, His scriptures, and His messengers, in what they have said about Him
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 7: The controller of all things with His perfect and absolute power
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 8: The dominant one with no equal
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 9: The executor of His will by compulsion and decree
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 10: The one who determines benefit and its owner
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 11: The guide, the right, who guides and enlightens the hearts of the sincere with His oneness
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 12: The one who created everything and then guided, the clear one in showing the path of truth
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 13: There is none like Him in His attributes, actions, judgments, or in any matter of His affairs
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 14: The eternal existence described by everlastingness
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 15: To whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, the Lord of everything, its inheritor, its provider, and its mercy
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 16: The guide of those who obey, so He guides whomever He wills by His guidance and leads astray whomever He wills by His abandonment
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 17: The one who grants respite and watches, who does not hasten, who does not delay, who does not rush, and the matter is decreed according to a known measure
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 18: The wide-reaching in mercy and sustenance
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 19: The source of peace and perfection
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 20: The guardian of truth and justice
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 21: The giver of gifts and bounties
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 22: The all-pervading, the sustainer of all
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 23: The bestower of honor and dignity
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 24: The source of peace and safety
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 25: The preserver of security and faith
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 32: The source of truth and guidance
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 33: The giver of light and illumination
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 34: The giver of guidance and wisdom
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 35: The guide to the right path
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 45: The guide to the path of truth
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 46: The guide to the straight path
allahNamesMeaning.Meaning 47: The guide to the way of righteousness

easyQuestions.question: Who was the first wife of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him)?
What is the meaning of "Sunnah" in Islam?
choices: The way of life prescribed as normative in Islam, based on the teachings and practices of the Prophet Muhammad and interpretations of the Quran.

easyQuestions.question: What is the name of the Islamic declaration of faith?
What is the name of the night journey of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) from Mecca to Jerusalem?
What is the term for giving charity in Islam?
Which angel is responsible for delivering revelations to prophets?
What is the holy book of Islam?
What is the name of the month of fasting in Islam?
What is the term for the pilgrimage to Mecca that is performed outside of the designated Hajj season?
Who is considered the first prophet in Islam?

mediumQuestions.question: What is the significance of the month of Ramadan in Islam?
choices: It is the month in which the Quran was revealed
It marks the birth of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him)
It commemorates the Battle of Badr
It is the month of fasting and spiritual reflection
